intro: Juncus brevirostris, commonly known as the short-beaked rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Juncaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and tall, cylindrical spikes of small, greenish flowers. Native to wetland and marshy habitats, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
